node.title: South Australia records highest daily COVID-19 total since April 2020, as international quarantine time cut
node.alt: A man wearing a suit and tie and glasses
node.description: South Australia records 25 new cases of COVID-19, the highest daily total since April 2020. The Premier says quarantine periods for international arrivals will reduce from 14 to seven days.
node.content:
["SA Health has revised\u00a0the state's daily\u00a0total number of new COVID-19 cases down to 25,\u00a0which remains\u00a0the highest daily total since April 2020.", "However, the number of aged care homes that were visited by one of two COVID-positive healthcare workers identified in yesterday's numbers\u00a0has been revised upwards to 22.", "Several of the facilities have been\u00a0locked down, with\u00a0infection control and testing measures\u00a0put in place.", "SA Health said the exposures \"were not widespread\" across the facilities and that all test results so far have been negative.", "Earlier, Premier Steven Marshall said a high level of testing was underway at those sites, but there was no evidence so far of further transmission.", "Mr Marshall said about 1,400 people were currently in quarantine.", "\"We're going to continue to have more cases in South Australia; importantly, though, we are seeing the number of people that are in directed quarantine continue to fall,\" he said.", "It is understood that two positive cases attended the University of South Australia's Mawson Lakes campus this week, but SA Health has not yet\u00a0listed it as\u00a0an exposure site.", "", "
Two\u00a0exposure sites have been announced in Willunga but the Willunga Hotel has also closed after concerns a COVID-19 case visited.(ABC News: Evelyn Manfield)
", "Mr Marshall defended the state's contact tracing, after a delay in naming\u00a0exposure sites\u00a0\u2014\u00a0including one\u00a0listed last night, 10 days after a case had attended.", "\"A lot of the information does come in late because you're speaking to people and then they recall where else they may have been or could have been an actual transmission that wasn't there previously,\" he said.", "\"So look I'm absolutely 100 per cent\u00a0convinced we have provided the adequate resources, we've been asked for more resources, we've provided more resources, I think our contact tracing is the best in the world.", "\"So it is important to list exposure sites so people have got some information, but we are at a different level of stress with regards to this disease from where we were two to three weeks ago and certainly where we were two to three months ago.\"", "
International arrival quarantine\u00a0cut to seven days
", "Mr Marshall said quarantine periods for international arrivals would reduce from 14 to seven days, effective immediately.", "The state had previously moved to seven-day quarantine when it opened its borders on November 23, but backtracked days later because of concerns over the Omicron variant of COVID-19.", "Mr Marshall said the change would provide \"huge relief\" for people travelling into the state\u00a0for Christmas.", "The Premier said the state was \"still working out\" what the quarantine period for international arrivals would be once the state reached\u00a090 per cent vaccination for the population 12 and over, but said it was \"unlikely that it would go to zero given the level of uncertainty with Omicron\".", "", "
Premier Steven Marshall said testing requirements would likely continue for travellers from NSW.(ABC News: Evelyn Manfield)
", "Mr Marshall said the \"significant increase\" in case numbers in NSW\u00a0meant\u00a0testing requirements for people travelling from that state\u00a0would remain \"for some time\".", "\"I\u00a0can't see us in South Australia removing that testing requirement pre-departure and after departure moving anytime soon,\" he said.", "SA Health has not added any exposure sites for today, but did revise\u00a0some of the previously listed sites.", "Check the table below to find all the sites and exposure windows.", "You can find information on\u00a0testing site hours and the nearest site to you on the SA Health\u00a0website.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
